citeinfo.title: Fine Particulate Matter (24-Hr, PM-2.5) NAAQS Designations, Region 9, 2015, US EPA Region 9
citeinfo.origin: U.S. Environmental Protection Agency, Region 9 AIR Division

descript.abstract: Designated Areas for particulate matter less than 2.5 microns, according to the 24-Hour National Ambient Air Quality Standards (NAAQS). Nonattainment areas are geographic areas which have not met NAAQS for Particulate Matter air pollution. These standards are part of the Clean Air Act. See Code of Federal Regulations, Section 40 Part 81, for detailed information about Ambient Air Quality Standards. More detailed information about NAAQS can be found on the following web page:http://www.epa.gov/airprogm/oar/oaqps/greenbk
descript.purpose: This data set is specifically designed for use with GIS software. Data may be used for reference to boundaries of attainment areas in Region 9.
descript.supplinf: Updated with reclassification of San Joaquin Valley nonattainment area as Serious nonattainment for the 1997 24-Hr PM-2.5 NAAQS, per 80 FR 18528.

idinfo.useconst: Intended use for small scale or regional mapping.
idinfo.datacred: Acknowledgement of US EPA Region 9 GIS Center.
idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 3; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.3.1.3500

attracc.attraccr: Designations and severity classifications are based on information from the CFR

dataqual.logic: The spatial data is based on the Code of Federal Regulations - Protection of Environment, PARTS 81 TO 99, Revised as of July, 2008.

horizpa.horizpar: Horizontal Accuracy is based on the Public Land Survey System (BLM). The spatial data is based on Public Land Survey System (PLSS), and political boundaries such as urban, county and State boundaries, thus the line work reflects the source; for example, PLSS or county.

procstep.procdesc: Feature class updated, removed deferred tribal lands.
SHP file and metadata updated to reflect Yuba City-Marysville designated area's switch to attainment.
SHP file and metadata updated to reflect San Joaquin Valley's reclassification as serious nonattainment for the 1997 NAAQS; field names added in attributes

metainfo.metstdn: FGDC Content Standard for Digital Geospatial Metadata

enttyp.enttypd: Fine Particulate Matter (PM-2.5) Nonattainment Areas for EPA Region 9.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Designation of area for the 1997 24-hour PM-2.5 standards

edom.edomvd: areas either have attaining air quality monitoring data or that air quality information is not available because the areas are not monitored, and the EPA has not determined that the areas contribute to a violation in a nearby area
any area that does not meet (or that contributes to ambient air quality in a nearby area that does not meet) the national primary or secondary ambient air quality standard for the pollutant

attr.attrdef: severity of pollution levels compared to the 1997 24-hour PM-2.5 NAAQS in a designated geographic area

edom.edomvd: area has ten years from effective date of designation to attain the NAAQS
area has six years from effective date of designation to attain the NAAQS

attr.attrdef: Date that 1997 24-hour PM-2.5 NAAQS designation is effective
Area of feature in internal units squared.

attrdomv.udom: Positive real numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Designation of area for the 2006 24-hour PM-2.5 standard

edom.edomvd: any area that does not meet (or that contributes to ambient air quality in a nearby area that does not meet) the national primary or secondary ambient air quality standard for the pollutant
any area that meets the national primary or secondary ambient air quality standard for the pollutant

areas either have attaining air quality monitoring data or that air quality information is not available because the areas are not monitored, and the EPA has not determined that the areas contribute to a violation in a nearby area

attr.attrdef: severity of pollution levels capared against the 2006 24-hour PM-2.5 NAAQS in a designated geographic area

edom.edomvd: area has six years from effective date of designation to attain the NAAQS

attr.attrdef: Date that 2006 NAAQS designation is effective
Length of feature in internal units.

attrdomv.udom: Positive real numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Hyperlink reference in Federal Register to designated area

overview.eaover: Attribute information showing 1997 and 2006 24-Hour PM-2.5 NAAQS designations of geographic areas in EPA Region 9. Areas with pollution levels at or below the 2006 24-hour PM-2.5 NAAQS of 35 micrograms per cubic meter (Âµg/m3) are attaining; areas with air monitoring data greater than 35 Âµg/m3 are violating the NAAQS.

dataIdInfo.idAbs: Designated Areas for particulate matter less than 2.5 microns, according to the 24-Hour National Ambient Air Quality Standards (NAAQS). Nonattainment areas are geographic areas which have not met NAAQS for Particulate Matter air pollution. These standards are part of the Clean Air Act. See Code of Federal Regulations, Section 40 Part 81, for detailed information about Ambient Air Quality Standards. More detailed information about NAAQS can be found on the following web page:http://www.epa.gov/airprogm/oar/oaqps/greenbk

report.measDesc: The spatial data is based on the Code of Federal Regulations - Protection of Environment, PARTS 81 TO 99, Revised as of July, 2008.
Designations and severity classifications are based on information from the CFR

Horizontal Accuracy is based on the Public Land Survey System (BLM). The spatial data is based on Public Land Survey System (PLSS), and political boundaries such as urban, county and State boundaries, thus the line work reflects the source; for example, PLSS or county.

prcStep.stepDesc: Feature class updated, removed deferred tribal lands.
SHP file and metadata updated to reflect Yuba City-Marysville designated area's switch to attainment.
SHP file and metadata updated to reflect San Joaquin Valley's reclassification as serious nonattainment for the 1997 NAAQS; field names added in attributes
